Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8486 submitting to the registered electors of the City of Boulder at the general municipal coordinated election to be held on Tuesday, November 2, 2021, the question of amending Sections 38A, 44, and 46 of the Boulder Home Rule Charter relating to the number of signatures of registered electors required on initiative, referenda and recall petitions; setting forth the ballot title; specifying the form of the ballot and other election procedures; and setting forth related details Third reading and motion to adopt Ordinance 8477 submitting to the electors of the City of Boulder at the general municipal coordinated election to be held on Tuesday, November 2, 2021, the question of amending Section 7 of the Boulder City Charter relating to council compensation, by requiring that council compensation be paid in equal amounts throughout the year to be paid on the same schedule as other city employees, setting forth the ballot title; specifying the form of the ballot and other election procedures; and setting forth related details

callup_checkin: Call-up Consideration: Landmark Alteration Certificate for installation of a 11.88 kW roof mounted solar PV system at 845 14th St., a contributing property in the University Place Historic District-NO ACTION

Call Up Item regarding a Three- Year Extension of Development Approval for the Use Review (LUR2016 00020) for attached residential in an industrial zoning district associated amenities located at 3289 Airport Boulevard. Velo Condos is a new neighborhood of 70 homes, planned in a five-building condominium community comprised of one, two, and three-bedroom for-sale homes that include on-site permanently affordable units and five live-work condominiums.  Construction has been completed on the first three of five buildings, and the applicant has presold 50 percent of the units.  The building permits are issued for the final two buildings with construction expected to begin at the end of 2021-NO ACTION

public_hearings.name: Ordinance 8474
public_hearings.description: Submitting to the qualified registered electors of the City of Boulder at the municipal coordinated election to be held on Tuesday, November 2, 2021, the question submitted as an initiated ordinance whether the City of Boulder shall adopt changes to the Boulder Revised Code to require that any agreement with the University of Colorado regarding terms of annexation for the land known as CU South include certain specific details, and that the annexation agreement gain voter approval in an election prior to provision of city utilities and services other than flood control facilities to or on any portion of CU South; setting forth the ballot title; specifying the form of the ballot and other election procedures; and setting forth related details

public_hearings.name: Ordinance 8475
public_hearings.description: submitting to the qualified electors of the City of Boulder at the municipal coordinated election to be held on Tuesday, November 2, 2021, the question submitted as an initiated ordinance whether the City of Boulder shall expand access to housing by allowing all housing units to be occupied by a number of people equal to the number of legal bedrooms, plus one additional person per home, provided that relevant health and safety codes are met; setting forth the ballot title; specifying the form of the ballot and other election procedures; and setting forth related details
speakers: Ryan Tanner Pooled w/ Blake Stone
Blake Stone – Pooled w/ Ryan Tanner and Sarah Campbell

public_hearings.name: Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8466 for Landmark Designation for 96 Arapahoe Ave. (Nuzum’s Nursery)
public_hearings.description: Marcy Gerwing, Historic Preservation Planner, introduced the item and provided a presentation with background information on the property.
public_hearings.motion: Motion to ADOPT Ordinance 8466 designating two buildings and a portion of the property at 96 Arapahoe Ave., to be known as Nuzum’s Nursery, as an individual landmark under the City of Boulder Historic Preservation Ordinance

public_hearings.name: Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8458
public_hearings.description: Amending Chapter 3-19, “Electronic Smoking Device Tax,” 4-32, “Tobacco Retailers,” 6-4, “Regulation of Smoking,” and 6-4.5, “Sale of Tobacco Products,” and Section 4-20- 75, “Tobacco Retailer License Fee,” B.R.C. 1981, to clarify licensing of tobacco and electronic smoking device retailers; tax on electronic smoking devices by all businesses; and setting forth related details Staff members Joel Wagner, Special Projects Manager and Kathy Haddock, Senior Counsel provided Council with a presentation outlining the changes to the codes.
public_hearings.motion: NO MOTION - Staff is directed to revisit the proposed amendments to Ordinance 8458, including review of the proposed language submitted by the industry, and solicit recommendations from the Cannabis Licensing Advisory Board. Staff is further directed to bring final recommendations back to Council for the continuation of 2nd reading

public_hearings.name: Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8462
public_hearings.description: Amending Chapter 3-20, “Rental License Excise Tax,” and Chapter 12-2, “Landlord – Tenant Relations,” B.R.C. 1981, making changes to implement the provisions related to eviction prevention and rental assistance services; and setting forth related details Staff members Joel Wagner, Special Projects Manager and Carin Armstrong, Community Mediation & Resolution Center Manager, provided Council with a presentation outlining the current work to date and changes to the code.
public_hearings.motion: Motion to ADOPT Ordinance 8462 amending Chapter 3-20, “Rental License Excise Tax,” and Chapter 12-2, “Landlord – Tenant Relations,”

This street is no longer planned or feasible given slopes and the existing development pattern.

callup_checkin: Call Up Consideration for the Concept Plan Review and Comment for the redevelopment of a 2.33-acre parcel that includes the addresses noted below, located primarily at 2504 Spruce Street, with 63 residential units, and an exercise room for residents. Reviewed under case no. LUR2021-00016

Introduction, first reading, and consideration of a motion to order published by title only, Ordinance 8508 amending Chapter 4-20 and Section 3-8-3, B.R.C. 1981, changing certain fees; and setting forth related details
Cheryl Pattelli, Chief Financial Officer, Mark Woulf, Budget Senior Manager, Kara  Skinner, Interim Chief Financial Officer, provided a presentation

Cherry Pattelli, Chief Financial Officer, Mark Woulf, Budget Senior Manager, Kara  Skinner, Interim Chief Financial Officer, David Farnan, Library and Arts Director,  Jacob Lindsay, Planner Director, Aimee Kane, Equity Manager, Erika  Vandenbrande, Transportation and Mobility Director answered questions from  Council.

items: Consideration of a motion to approve the election returns from the 2021 Coordinated Municipal Election held on November 2, 2021
Motion to convene as the General Canvassing and Election Board for the City of Boulder Coordinated Municipal Election
Roll call of the General Canvassing and Election Board
Administration of oath and signing of same by Board members
Consideration of a motion nominating a member to chair the Board

Submission of the following to the Board found in Attachments: Statement of Votes, Summary of Votes, Boulder County Audit, Reconciliation Report and Certification Statement of Election Results and Certification for the Colorado Department of Local Affairs
Consideration of a motion to approve the election returns and, if approved, signing of the Certificate of the General Canvassing and Election Board
Motion to adjourn from the General Canvassing and Election Board for the City of Boulder Coordinated Municipal Election and reconvene as the Boulder City Council

Consideration of a motion to approve, and authorize the city manager to execute any documents necessary related to, the extinguishment of a 60-foot-wide nonexclusive easement for underground utilities, and a right-of-way for ingress and egress, to the City of Boulder’s Kassler Open Space property pursuant to the disposal procedures of Article XII, Section 177, of the Boulder City Charter, and conditioned upon release of private interests in the same and a City of Boulderapproved development plan for the Canyonside Office Park Lots 1-3 that includes agreed-upon provisions related to burying utilities and boundary fencing
